intro: Wikstroemia salicina, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and forest understories. The plant has cultural significance in Hawaiian traditional practices and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
